inclusion.criterion: left or right-sided chronic stroke patients
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: MRI of the head revealed an acute 1.7-cm infarct of the right periventricular white matter and posterior right basal ganglia.

inclusion.criterion: left or right-sided chronic stroke patients
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Left-sided facial droop, dysarthria, and left-sided hemiplegia were seen in the physical exam.

exclusion.criterion: Patients with cognitive impairment or unable to follow commands
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: He denied dyspnea, headache, palpitations, chest pain, fever, dizziness, bowel or urinary incontinence, loss of consciousness.

notes: 62-year-old African-American man with left upper and lower extremity weakness, associated with dark visual spot in right eye, right facial numbness, facial drop and slurred speech. He has hypertension, hyperlipidemia and hypothyroidism.
